trans-unit.source: Key Vault
trans-unit.target: Key Vault

trans-unit.source: Azure Key Vault
trans-unit.target: Azure Key Vault

trans-unit.source: Key Vault
trans-unit.target: Key Vault

trans-unit.source: <token>azure_key_vault</token> is available in most regions.
trans-unit.target: <token>azure_key_vault</token> is available in most regions.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the <externalLink><linkText>Key Vault pricing page</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/key-vault/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the <externalLink><linkText>Key Vault pricing page</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/key-vault/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Use the Key Vault to manage cryptographic keys within the Microsoft Azure environment.
trans-unit.target: Use the Key Vault to manage cryptographic keys within the Microsoft Azure environment.

trans-unit.source: Key Vault supports multiple key types and algorithms and can be used with hardware security modules (HSM) for high-value customer keys.
trans-unit.target: Key Vault supports multiple key types and algorithms and can be used with hardware security modules (HSM) for high-value customer keys.

trans-unit.source: In addition, you can use Key Vault to securely store secrets which are limited size octet objects with no specific semantics.
trans-unit.target: In addition, you can use Key Vault to securely store secrets which are limited size octet objects with no specific semantics.

trans-unit.source: A key vault can contain a mix of keys and secrets.
trans-unit.target: A key vault can contain a mix of keys and secrets.

trans-unit.source: Access control for the types of objects is independently managed.
trans-unit.target: Access control for the types of objects is independently managed.

trans-unit.source: Users, subject to successful authorization, can do the following:
trans-unit.target: Users, subject to successful authorization, can do the following:

trans-unit.source: Manage cryptographic keys using Create, Import, Update, Delete and other operations
trans-unit.target: Manage cryptographic keys using Create, Import, Update, Delete and other operations

trans-unit.source: Manage secrets using Get, Set, Delete and other operations
trans-unit.target: Manage secrets using Get, Set, Delete and other operations

trans-unit.source: Use cryptographic keys with Sign/Verify, WrapKey/UnwrapKey and Encrypt/Decrypt operations
trans-unit.target: Use cryptographic keys with Sign/Verify, WrapKey/UnwrapKey and Encrypt/Decrypt operations

trans-unit.source: Operations against key vaults are authenticated and authorized by using Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Operations against key vaults are authenticated and authorized by using Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Programming for Key Vault
trans-unit.target: Programming for Key Vault

trans-unit.source: The Key Vault management system for programmers currently consists of several interfaces of which REST forms the base functionality for all interaction with the Key Vault.
trans-unit.target: The Key Vault management system for programmers currently consists of several interfaces of which REST forms the base functionality for all interaction with the Key Vault.

trans-unit.source: Additional Information for IT Administrators
trans-unit.target: Additional Information for IT Administrators

trans-unit.source: In addition to <externalLink><linkText>What is Azure Key Vault</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/key-vault-whatis/</linkUri></externalLink>, see also <externalLink><linkText>Get Started with Azure Key Vault </linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/key-vault-get-started/</linkUri></externalLink>, <externalLink><linkText>Azure Key Vault Cmdlets</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn868052.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>, and <externalLink><linkText>Managing Key Vault with CLI</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/key-vault-manage-with-cli</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: In addition to <externalLink><linkText>What is Azure Key Vault</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/key-vault-whatis/</linkUri></externalLink>, see also <externalLink><linkText>Get Started with Azure Key Vault </linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/key-vault-get-started/</linkUri></externalLink>, <externalLink><linkText>Azure Key Vault Cmdlets</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn868052.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>, and <externalLink><linkText>Managing Key Vault with CLI</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/key-vault-manage-with-cli</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Administrators might also need the following additional documentation:
trans-unit.target: Administrators might also need the following additional documentation:

trans-unit.source: How to Generate and Transfer HSM-Protected Keys for Azure Key Vault
trans-unit.target: How to Generate and Transfer HSM-Protected Keys for Azure Key Vault
